thread.title_full: Rosie Batty's partner was charged with child porn offences | Daily Mail Online

author: Nelson Groom For Daily Mail Australia
title: Rosie Batty's partner was charged with child porn offences | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 'They chose to maintain Greg's confidentiality instead of Luke's safety,' Ms Batty said. After child protection services investigated the matter, an apprehended violence order was filed against Anderson, but it failed to prevent him from murdering their son at cricket practice at Tyabb, a town southeast of Melbourne. Rosie Batty has criticised authorities for putting her ex-partner's privacy ahead of her son Luke's safety The murder of Luke Batty at cricket practice in February 2014 sparked a royal commission The crime scene at Tyabb, southwest of Melbourne, where Luke was stabbed to death in 2014 Ms Batty has campaigned tirelessly, making media and public speaking appearances to shine a spotlight on the issue and call for systemic changes. She will speak at a world-first conference in Melbourne on Wednesday about the families of child sex offenders. An inquest found that while there were failures in the justice system, police and child protection officers did not believe he would harm their son, even though he had previously been violent towards her. Luke's murder sparked a royal commission into family violence in Victoria, and new laws to protect victims of domestic violence. While Greg Anderson had initially been a loving father, he turned out to be a monster who was violent towards Rosie Batty and who would ultimately kill their son Luke (pictured as a baby) Rosie Batty was named the 2015 Australian of the Year for her work highlight domestic violence and failures within the child welfare and justice systems Share or comment on this article 131
